5 single_crochet in each stitch around 6 stitches row 6 *increase single_crochet 2* repeat around twice 8 stitches row 7 single_crochet around 8 stitches row 8 *increase single_crochet 3* repeat around twice 10 stitches row 9-11 single_crochet around 10 stitches row 12 *increase single_crochet 4* repeat around twice 12 stitches row 13 *increase single_crochet 5* repeat around twice 14 stitches row 14 *increase single_crochet 6* repeat around twice 16 stitches row 15 *increase single_crochet 7* repeat around twice 18 stitches row 16 *increase single_crochet 8* repeat around twice 20 stitches row 17 *increase single_crochet 9* repeat around twice 22 stitches row 18 *increase single_crochet 10* repeat around twice 24 stitches change to white in the last stitch criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-christmas-hat-ornament brim / frill / edging i have included two choices for the end row of the hat the half_double_crochet row will result in a straight edge the shells row will give it a wavy edge another option is you can join in a strand of white flutter yarn which makes the last row really fluffy crochet over both the red and white tail ends here now to save having to sew them in after row 19 in white - single_crochet around 24 stitches row 20 a straight edge half_double_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 half_double_crochet join with a slip_stitch row 20 b wavy edge slip stich into the next stitch then *skip 1 stitch 5 half_double_crochet in the next stitch skip one stitch slip_stitch in next stitch* repeat around you should have 6 little frills on the bottom the last slip_stitch is also the final join in the work bind bind off and secure the white thread hide the end of the yarn in the work hat tip to add the fluffy pompom or bell use the magic_ring red thread to tie it to the tip of the hat shape flatten the hat so that the red/white colour change jog is in the corner of the hat fold the hat tip over and stitch it securely to the side of the main hat hang if you want to add a thread to hang the hat from you can  crochet 25-30 chains and tie to the top of the work  simply tie a thread of unworked yarn at the
